title: Chief Digital Guide (aka Parent)
description:
**Company** 
 :
   

 Trustyou is a digital co-parent that helps parents guide their children towards healthy digital habits, support emotional well-being, and keep kids safe online. It’s built for trust, not control.
   

  

**Location** 
 :
   

 Your home, your rules. But we’re everywhere your kid’s screen is.
   

  

**Job Description** 
 :
   

 Tired of guessing what your kid is doing online?
   

  

 Worried about screen time, sneaky apps, or mood swings after too much scrolling?
   

 Good. That means you care. That means you're hired.
   

  

 At Trustyou, we're building a digital parenting assistant that helps you raise emotionally healthy, screen-smart kids — without turning into the “bad guy.”
   

  

**Your Responsibilities:**
* Worry about your kids’ online life (you're already doing it).
* Try to keep up with TikTok trends (we'll help with that).
* Learn how to guide, not just control.
* Test-drive the future of digital parenting.
* Give us your brutally honest feedback (the more real, the better).


**Perks** 
 :
   

* First access to our private waitlist.
* Sneak peeks, free trials, and early features.
* Community of like-minded parents


**Tools that actually help**
 Oh, and you're still the boss at home
   

  

**How to Apply:**
* Click the link and Join the waitlist: https://trustyou.io
* Follow us for tips, tools, and the occasional meme that gets it.


 P.S. This is not just a sign-up. It’s a movement.
   

  

 Let’s stop reacting. Let’s start leading.

title: Integration Consultant
description:
**Den viktiga digitaliseringen av vården fortsätter att utvecklas och i takt med det växer B3 HealthTech så att det knakar. Vi söker nu erfarna integrationskonsulter som vill bli en del av ett företag som bidrar till att tillgängliggöra och effektivisera det svenska hälso- och sjukvårdsystemet.**
 Vi söker dig som vill arbeta i ett företag med sympatiska värderingar, erfarna kollegor och ett härlig driv. Om du, liksom vi, värnar om en arbetsmiljö där ödmjukhet, prestigelös kunskapsdelning och energi frodas så är detta en unik chans för dig att vara med och bidra till vår starka kultur. Hos oss får du även möjlighet att växa i din yrkesroll och vara med och bidra till samhällsnyttig utveckling varje dag.
   

  

**Om rollen** 
**:**
 Som konsult hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med intressanta uppdrag hos våra kunder inom både den privata och den offentliga sektorn för att stödja dem i deras digitaliseringsresor. I rollen kan du komma att få arbeta med integration av verksamhetskritiska system inom hälso- och sjukvården, integration av nationella tjänster, utveckling och integration mellan privata vårdaktörer och nationella hälso- och sjukvården och mycket annat.
   

  

**Ett CV säger inte allt, men vi ser att:**
* Du har arbetat med systemintegrationer och API:er.
* Du har goda kunskaper inom Mulesoft, Apache Camel, intersystem eller liknande.
* Du har erfarenhet från att ha arbetat med integrationslösningar för större organisationer.
* Du har minst 4 års relevant erfarenhet.
* Du behärskar svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


**Det är en bonus om:**
* Du tidigare har arbetat som konsult.
* Du har arbetat med Cosmic eller integrationer mot vårdinformationsstöd
* Arbetat med integrationslösningar mot större datalager.
* Du har erfarenhet från att ha arbetat med standarder för medicinsk informatik. Som exempelvis FHIR, HL7, OpenEHR eller liknande.


**Vi erbjuder**
* Attraktiv lönemodell.
* Friskvårdsbidrag och tjänstepension.
* Goda förutsättningar för flexibla arbetstider
* Möjligheter att gå relevanta utbildningar och ta attraktiva certifikat.
* En fantastisk wellness-satning.


 B3 HealthTech är en del av B3 Consulting Group, ett av Sveriges snabbast växande företag inom IT och management. Således kan vi erbjuda det bästa av två världar - styrkan hos ett stort börsnoterat bolag i kombination med den härliga samhörigheten som ett mindre bolag erbjuder. I och med att vi enbart är 35 medarbetare så hamnar dessutom fokus på dig och dina unika utvecklingsbehov.
   

  

 Vi är stolta över att vi vann priset som ”Årets Karriärföretag” 2022, vilket vi även är nominerade till i år, och kom på tredje plats som Sveriges bästa bolag enligt ”Great Place to Work 2021”. Vi tror att det beror på vår energi, vårt sätt att välkomna olikheter och våra erfarenheter som vi gärna delar med oss av. En central del av energiskapandet är vår unika wellness-satsning Team B3. Vad sägs om 250+ aktiviteter som sträcker sig från Crossfit, Vasa lopp och padelspel till bokklubbar, handarbetescafé och brädspelskvällar. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra, presterar bra och vill vara engagerade kollegor och goda medmänniskor.
   

  

 De som jobbar kvar hos oss efter många år pratar om friheten att påverka sina uppdrag, arbetstider och utveckling. De talar även om stoltheten över att vara en del av ett bolag som inte bara levererar förstklassigt resultat till sina kunder utan även tar ansvar för samhället i stort bl.a. genom att vara partner till fina initiativ som Women in Tech, Changers Hub, Pink Programming m.fl.
   

  

**Låter det som något för dig?**
 Vi vill fortsätta att växa, så ansök till oss idag och följ med på vår resa mot en mer effektiv hälso- och sjukvård. Vi kommer att intervjua kandidater löpande och ber dig därför att skicka in din ansökan redan idag.
   

  

 Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail, men har du frågor som rör tjänsten så tveka inte att höra av dig till Christina Löfgren christina.lofgren@b3.se 079-3356532

title: Finance Controller (ALLEX Graduate Program)
description:
Nordic Infucare started its journey as an entrepreneurial company with the desire to do things differently. Mats Bergryd founded the business to offer specialized treatments in a home environment, serving patients who suffer from chronic disease. He chose that niche as he, after 20 years in the industry, had identified a gap between what was possible to achieve with smart technology and pharmaceuticals, and the actual result. Mats concluded that there was an opportunity to increase the quality of life or patients with chronic disease by closing the gap, and that it would be good business for the one who succeeded.
   

  

 Since the start in 2002 we have grown into a company with more than 100 employees. Today we are a part of the Air Liquide group, but the patient’s quality of life still guides all our actions.
   

  

 Creative problem solvers
   

  

 Something we all have in common at Nordic Infucare is that we like solving problems and that we are motivated by making a difference for the patients. There is no doubt in our minds that we harness the most of our employees’ creativity and top performances when we don’t lock them into processes but set them free to find their own solutions.
   

  

**How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?**
 Nordic Infucare, part of the Air Liquide Group, is seeking an ambitious Graduate Controller to join our dynamic team and become a key financial partner to the business. This is a great opportunity to develop skills in financial analysis, reporting, and forecasting, while gaining invaluable experience in a multinational environment as an ALLEX ( Air Liquide Leading EXcellence Program) Graduate.
   

  

 Reporting directly to the CFO, and working closely with the Finance Manager you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Producing accurate monthly financial reports and analyse quarterly variances for both Nordic Infucare and the Air Liquide Group
* Analysing Nordic Infucare's financial performance, identifying trends, and recommending strategic solutions to management
* Collaborating with stakeholders to achieve financial targets by providing detailed performance analysis and actionable insights that support key business decisions
* Contributing to the development and implementation of the company's strategic financial plan.
* Developing and maintaining Finance Power BI dashboards, creating key performance indicators (KPIs) and reports to enhance financial visibility
* Contributing to diverse finance and strategy projects, gaining broad business experience
* Providing ad-hoc financial analysis and support to the Chief Financial Officer as and when needed.


**Are you a MATCH?**
 To be eligible for the ALLEX program, you must have a relevant Bachelors or Masters Degree, and no more than 36 months of post grad work experience.
   

  

 You will also need:
   

  

* A degree in Accounting, Business, Economics, Finance or a related field
* Practical experience in controlling and financial reporting, gained through internships or postgraduate roles (within the 36- month limit)
* Excellent communication skills with a structured, proactive way of working
* Fluency in English (essential); proficiency in any Nordic language (preferred)
* Strong business acumen and a customer/ patient mindset
* To be dynamic, curious, ambitious & enthusiastic


**About The ALLEX Program**
 The Air Liquide Leading EXcellence Program (ALLEX) Program is Air Liquide's international graduate program for talented and ambitious fresh graduates from all over Europe.
   

  

 By participating in this program, you will have the opportunity to kick start your career by making an important contribution to your team and developing your skills on a professional and personal level.
   

  

 As an ALLEX participant you will:
   

  

* Hold a permanent position with responsibilities with Nordic Infucare
* Develop yourself through two international assignments within Europe (3 months each) over a 3 years period of time. You will discover other business areas, activities, country and working environment of Air Liquide.
* Benefit from an international network: through physical and virtual events, development programs and mentoring


**Our Differences make our Performance**
 At Air Liquide, we are committed to build a diverse and inclusive workplace that embraces the diversity of our employees, our customers, patients, community stakeholders and cultures across the world.
   

  

 We welcome and consider applications from all qualified applicants, regardless of their background. We strongly believe a diverse organization opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to innovate by living our fundamentals, acting for our success and creating an engaging environment in a changing world.

title: Account Executive - Sweden
description:
Are you ready to significantly impact the future of SaaS and telematics? Join ABAX Sweden as we expand our sales team and seek motivated Sales Representatives! 🚀
   

  

 You will play a crucial part in building and expanding our customer base. You will conduct engaging business meetings with potential customers you've identified through proactive prospecting, and you'll have the opportunity to negotiate and close contracts successfully. Your goal will be to create real business value by understanding our client's needs and challenges and presenting them with tailored products and solutions. You will take complete ownership of the sales process from start to finish.
   

  

 For your first 12 months, you'll own your customer portfolio, giving you the opportunity to enhance your earnings through upselling and cross-selling while nurturing valuable relationships. ⭐
   

  

 We are looking for a dynamic individual with sales experience, particularly in making first contact through cold calling, and who thrives in a target-driven environment. At ABAX, we believe in nurturing talent, and we are eager to connect with enthusiastic individuals who have the potential to become our next top sellers. We encourage all applicants to apply, regardless of their prior experience, as we are actively recruiting throughout our sales department. Join us in shaping a successful future together!⭐
   

  

**Some of the things you will be working on:**
* Identifying prospects, generating leads, and building pipelines for potential customers
* Booking and conducting client meetings
* Managing the entire sales process from initial contact to contract closure
* Working closely with the onboarding team ensuring a thorough onboarding journey for our new customer at ABAX
* Identify opportunities to upsell within the first 12 months of owning the customer and ensuring retention
* Utilize our reporting tools, CRM system, and sales training resources.


**We believe you bring:**
* Demonstrated some experience in sales, preferably experience in cold sales and booking meetings.
* Ability to conduct effective business meetings.
* Thriving in a KPI metrics-driven environment, with a focus on achieving and exceeding performance targets
* Comfortable using Microsoft Office, CRM software, and other online tools
* Exceptional communication and networking abilities
* Proficient written, verbal, and presentation capabilities in Swedish


**Nice-to-have:**
* Familiarity with SaaS, telematics, and mobility data solutions.


**Background Check and Reference Verification:**
 Successful employment is contingent upon ABAX receiving satisfactory references.
   

  

 As part of our hiring process, we perform a digital reference check through RefApp, an advanced online solution for managing this procedure.
   

  

 Please be aware that a background check may be conducted simultaneously with the reference check.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities:**
*At ABAX, we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. This commitment extends to ensuring that our recruitment practices and processes are as inclusive as possible. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to join us in strengthening our focus on equality and diversity in the workplace.*
**About ABAX:**
 ABAX unlocks company data potential by translating the customers' needs into advanced technology solutions.
   

  

 ABAX is one of the largest telematics companies in Europe with solutions for mileage claims, tool tracking, and equipment control with over 500 000 tracked units all over the world. In 2020 ABAX started a journey expanding into developing mobility data solutions entering new verticals like insurance and leasing being the preferred mobility data provider for the B2B industry on a wider scale. ABAX solutions help our customers run their businesses smarter and more sustainable, making it easy to improve efficiency, comply with legislation, and increase profitability.
   

  

 We know happy employees equal happy customers, and we do our utmost to facilitate employee satisfaction, both in and out of work. We have around 300 employees spread across offices in nine countries. Our Headquarters and Tech Centre are situated in Larvik, on the southeast coast of Norway. Our values: Enthusiastic, Customer-centric, Innovative, and Sustainable form the foundation of our daily work, every hour of every day.

title: M&A Manager
description:
Dometic is a global market leader in the mobile living industry. Millions of people around the world use Dometic products in outdoor, residential, and professional applications. We are on a growth journey – now looking for our next star – a driven and analytical M&A Manager to our HQ in Solna Strand.
   

  

**About The Position**
 As M&A Manager you will play an important role in Dometic’s transformation journey by driving acquisition and divestment projects. The M&A manager will lead and co-ordinate both internal and external resources with the support from Head of M&A, to whom the position reports. Further, the M&A manager will work to ensure best practices are being defined and implemented, both for acquisitions and carve-outs/divesture. The M&A Manager will contribute to the strategic work of the group by performing analyses and develop sharp and well-structured presentation materials for evaluation and decision-making.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* Project management of M&A and carve-out processes, with support from Head of M&A – including hands-on project co-ordination and leadership of the different workstreams in an M&A process, from start to finish.
* Support the Dometic group with financial and commercial analysis and evaluation of its business operations, markets, competitors and various strategic options.
* Support business segments with strategic planning and execution, by searching for acquisition targets and analyzing its potential strategic, commercial, financial, organizational and cultural fit.
* Perform financial modelling and valuation analysis of acquisition targets and divesture candidates.
* Support the M&A function in the continued development of best-in-class tools and templates being used for research, valuation, due diligence, carve-out and project management.


**What do we offer?**
 As M&A Manager at Dometic, you will be offered a great opportunity to both broaden and deepen your knowledge within M&A. You will have significant interactions with different parts of the organization, including the CEO and the CFO as well as Segment Presidents. You will deepen your understanding of the M&A process but also gain great understanding of general business drivers as well as a broad range of operational topics. You are offered an interesting role in a dynamic, fast paced and global environment with great opportunities to grow, evolve with the company and take on new challenges.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**A suitable background would be a** 
 at least 3 years of hands-on M&A experience within financial advisory at a bank, transaction service team or experience from a top tier management consultant firm – as well as the following qualifications and experiences:
   

  

* BSc or MSc in Finance, Economics, Business or Industrial Engineering.
* Strategic Project management experience
* Ideally experience of both divestures (preferable corporate carve-outs) and acquisitions
* Fluent in English – proficient in both verbal and written communication.


**To be successful in this role, we believe that you possess the following skills, competencies & characteristics:**
* Positive attitude – you demonstrate curiosity and a strong eagerness to learn.
* Good communication skills – you skillfully express ideas and information, both verbally and in writing.
* Strong relationship-building skills – you confidently engage with colleagues at all levels across the organization.
* Diligent with strong attention to detail – you ensure accuracy and thoroughness in your work.
* Strong numerical skills – you are skilled at and comfortable in working with numbers and data.
* Strong business acumen and a good understanding of financial markets
* Well developed commercial understanding and strategic thinking.
* Driven and motivated – you ensure progress and keep things moving forward.
* Finally, you are a person who naturally bring a positive vibe – your energy and enthusiasm rubs off!


**Dometic's Core Values**
 To thrive and succeed in this role, you understand the importance of our core values – Together We build our future, We play to win, We embrace change and We walk the talk; these values reflect the heart and soul of Dometic and they define what it takes to work here and how we do things.
   

  

 Dometic operates with a 4+1 policy, 4 days per week in the office and the possibility to work 1 day per week remotely. We see the social aspect of being in the office, meeting colleagues, having short coffee break interactions or a quick face to face meeting as key to success as we become more productive and fast paced in terms of problem solving, learning, cross functional collaboration and not the least in a way to have fun at work!
   

  

**Are you our next star?** 
 Then we would love to see your application. Selection is being made on a running basis. If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Anna Allert, Talent Acquisition at anna.allert@dometic.com
   

  

 In this recruitment both personality and logical tests will be used as well as background check on final candidate, as part of the process.

title: Natural Resources Underwriter_ Sweden
description:
**Company Description**
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
 Chubb is a world leader in insurance. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. As an underwriting company, we assess, assume and manage risk with insight and discipline. We service and pay our claims fairly and promptly. The company is also defined by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength and local operations globally. Parent company Chubb Limited is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: CB) and is a component of the S&P 500 index. Chubb maintains executive offices in Zurich, New York, London, Paris and other locations, and employs approximately 40,000 people worldwide. Additional information can be found at: www.chubb.com .
   

  

*In the Nordics we are an organization of 140 employees.*
**Purpose Of The Role**
 Chubb is growing and we are looking for a passionate Natural Resources Underwriter to join our team in the Nordics. In the role as Underwriter, you will focus specifically on Natural Resources.
   

  

 Are you ready for the next step in your career and would you prefer to take it in a fun and professional team at an international, renowned insurer? Then you are in the right place.
   

  

 This exciting role can suit an Underwriter who is hungry, motivated, inquisitive and in need of a new challenge. We will consider a similar minded hardworking person who feels ready to take the next step in the career.
   

  

 We require someone to develop and assist in underwriting Contractors All Risks and Power Generation risks associated with Natural Resources. Maintaining and building relationships with our Nordic brokers community with an ambition to write additional new business, which will be key to the success of this role, as well as growing the existing portfolio in line with our agreed growth targets, pricing, and retention budget.
   

  

 You make an impact and strengthen our market position by:
   

  

* Building and maintaining good relationships with brokers.
* Promoting our capabilities and building of a profitable Natural Resources portfolio.
* Strong commercial drive, always looking for new opportunities and value service and quality.
* Ensuring quality control by means of including underwriting and peer reviews.
* Representing and promoting Chubb to brokers and clients.
* Delivering strong service to brokers and clients, responding to cross-sell and new business opportunities and monitoring retention.
* Meeting the portfolio product line objectives for each underwriting year.
* Assisting in underwriting CAR/EAR and B&M LOBs to achieving underwriting profitability.


**Qualifications**
**Qualifications :**
* Fundamental understanding of and experience from underwriting processes preferably within construction , power generation or property underwriting, the insurance market, and competitors.
* Degree in Engineering or technical experience background with an interest for new technologies.
* A strong commercial drive and very customer-oriented approach.
* Experience from client servicing preferably from the insurance industry.
* Demonstrated skills in building and maintaining client relationships preferably from the insurance industry.
* Results driven, disciplined and ambitious with ability to work on own initiative.
* Good communicator and fluent in Swedish (or another Nordic language) and high level of English written as well as spoken.


**Why You Want To Work At Chubb**
* We offer a high-performance work environment in which appreciation and inclusiveness are of paramount importance.
* As an underwriter at Chubb, no two days are the same. You interact with various stakeholders and actively pursue opportunities. Where you do that? From our office in Stockholm, on location during meetings with clients/brokers or from your home office.
* At Chubb, the customer experience is key. With us, insurance is not a static product, but is continuously adapted to the needs of the market.
* As a Chubb employee, you are part of the world's largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company, providing solutions to businesses of all sizes.
* At Chubb, we operate on the basis of trust. You have a high degree of autonomy, flexibility and also access to a multitude of training and development opportunities.


 If you have any questions, please feel free to contact
 **Anna Källs,** 
 Country Manager Sweden,
   

  

 anna.källs@chubb.com
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Natural Resources Underwriter_ Sweden
description:
**Company Description**
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
 Chubb is a world leader in insurance. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. As an underwriting company, we assess, assume and manage risk with insight and discipline. We service and pay our claims fairly and promptly. The company is also defined by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength and local operations globally. Parent company Chubb Limited is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: CB) and is a component of the S&P 500 index. Chubb maintains executive offices in Zurich, New York, London, Paris and other locations, and employs approximately 40,000 people worldwide. Additional information can be found at: www.chubb.com .
   

  

*In the Nordics we are an organization of 140 employees.*
**Purpose Of The Role**
 Chubb is growing and we are looking for a passionate Natural Resources Underwriter to join our team in the Nordics. In the role as Underwriter, you will focus specifically on Natural Resources.
   

  

 Are you ready for the next step in your career and would you prefer to take it in a fun and professional team at an international, renowned insurer? Then you are in the right place.
   

  

 This exciting role can suit an Underwriter who is hungry, motivated, inquisitive and in need of a new challenge. We will consider a similar minded hardworking person who feels ready to take the next step in the career.
   

  

 We require someone to develop and assist in underwriting Contractors All Risks and Power Generation risks associated with Natural Resources. Maintaining and building relationships with our Nordic brokers community with an ambition to write additional new business, which will be key to the success of this role, as well as growing the existing portfolio in line with our agreed growth targets, pricing, and retention budget.
   

  

 You make an impact and strengthen our market position by:
   

  

* Building and maintaining good relationships with brokers.
* Promoting our capabilities and building of a profitable Natural Resources portfolio.
* Strong commercial drive, always looking for new opportunities and value service and quality.
* Ensuring quality control by means of including underwriting and peer reviews.
* Representing and promoting Chubb to brokers and clients.
* Delivering strong service to brokers and clients, responding to cross-sell and new business opportunities and monitoring retention.
* Meeting the portfolio product line objectives for each underwriting year.
* Assisting in underwriting CAR/EAR and B&M LOBs to achieving underwriting profitability.


**Qualifications**
**Qualifications :**
* Fundamental understanding of and experience from underwriting processes preferably within construction , power generation or property underwriting, the insurance market, and competitors.
* Degree in Engineering or technical experience background with an interest for new technologies.
* A strong commercial drive and very customer-oriented approach.
* Experience from client servicing preferably from the insurance industry.
* Demonstrated skills in building and maintaining client relationships preferably from the insurance industry.
* Results driven, disciplined and ambitious with ability to work on own initiative.
* Good communicator and fluent in Swedish (or another Nordic language) and high level of English written as well as spoken.


**Why You Want To Work At Chubb**
* We offer a high-performance work environment in which appreciation and inclusiveness are of paramount importance.
* As an underwriter at Chubb, no two days are the same. You interact with various stakeholders and actively pursue opportunities. Where you do that? From our office in Stockholm, on location during meetings with clients/brokers or from your home office.
* At Chubb, the customer experience is key. With us, insurance is not a static product, but is continuously adapted to the needs of the market.
* As a Chubb employee, you are part of the world's largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company, providing solutions to businesses of all sizes.
* At Chubb, we operate on the basis of trust. You have a high degree of autonomy, flexibility and also access to a multitude of training and development opportunities.


 If you have any questions, please feel free to contact
 **Anna Källs,** 
 Country Manager Sweden,
   

  

 anna.källs@chubb.com
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Procurement Manager
company_industry: Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution
description:
Do you want to be part of facilitating the green transition? Do you thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where your actions drive meaningful change? Do you enjoy solving hard problems together with ambitious people? If this sounds like you, this could be a perfect match.
   

  

 Today, Ingrid Capacity is in a rapid growth phase with a historic expansion of energy storage in Sweden, while also expanding internationally. We are in the final phase of construction of around 200 MW and will soon enter a new phase of construction of another 200 MW, with a total development pipeline of over 5 GW across Europe.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a motivated and dynamic Procurement Manager for our growing team to help manage all aspects of our procurement processes. Your work will contribute to ensuring efficiency, cost effectiveness and timely delivery of goods and services. You will be involved in supplier and sub-supplier market analysis, forecasting technology trends, pricing and lead times. You will also participate in strategic sourcing of equipment and construction suppliers, working closely with various teams. You will process and present data to effectively monitor contracts, verify and record commercial benefits, track the status of procurement projects, perform cost-benefit analyses, and assess commercial risk. The role includes traveling. You will report directly to the Head of Procurement.
   

  

**Key Tasks And Responsibilities**
**Supplier and Sub-supplier Market Analysis**
* Conduct in-depth market research and analysis to identify potential suppliers and understand underlying cost drivers.
* Monitor industry trends, technological advancements, pricing fluctuations, and lead times to inform procurement decisions.
* Develop strategies based on market insights to optimize procurement outcomes.


**Sourcing, Screening, and Supplier Relationship Management (SRM)**
* Source and screen suppliers to ensure alignment with ESG, bankability, quality, cost, and delivery requirements.
* Establish and maintain strong relationships with suppliers, negotiating contracts and terms to achieve favorable agreements.
* Implement effective supplier performance evaluation processes and drive continuous improvement through SRM practices.


**Strategic Procurement and Collaboration**
* Collaborate closely with Financial, Construction, Engineering, and Development teams to understand project requirements and timelines to optimize value.
* Develop or support strategic procurement plans aligned with project objectives, budget constraints, and quality standards.
* Lead and support procurement efforts for equipment and construction suppliers, ensuring adherence to project timelines and specifications.


**Contract Management and Support**
 Support the construction team during project execution by managing contracts, including drafting, negotiation, and execution.
   

  

 Ensure compliance with contractual terms, specifications, and regulatory requirements.
   

  

 Resolve any procurement-related issues or disputes that may arise during the construction phase.
   

  

**Your Work Experience**
* Bachelor’s degree in supply chain management, Procurement, Business Administration, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience in procurement or sourcing or supplier management.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret market data and make data driven decisions.
* Excellent negotiation and communication skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships at all levels.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


**Nice to have**
* Master’s degree preferred.
* Knowledge of contract law and experience in contract management.
* Experience in procurement in the construction or engineering industry.
* Knowledge and experience with renewables business provides a favorable aspect.
* Proficiency in procurement software and ERP systems.


 The experience listed above would all be interesting to add to the team, but you don't need experience in all of them to apply. You will work with a very knowledgeable team, so it is more important that you have the willingness and motivation to learn new skills.
   

  

**Your Personal Skills**
 In addition to relevant work experience, we’re looking for someone with the right personal skills and motivation, and a genuine passion for renewable energy. To be successful in this role at Ingrid Capacity, you should have strong analytical skills, excellent negotiation skills and a strategic mindset. Effective communication and interpersonal skills are essential for building and maintaining supplier relationships and collaborating with internal teams. You thrive in a high-growth environment and enjoy taking ownership. At Ingrid Capacity we encourage self-leadership and knowledge sharing, and therefore we believe that you enjoy working independently and driving your work forward, while also collaborating closely with other functions.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 At Ingrid Capacity, we are not just employees; we are pioneers, visionaries, and catalysts for change. We are at the forefront of the global energy transition, dedicated to shaping the future of power generation. Our company is more than a workplace; it is a platform for innovation, where we dare to push boundaries and turn bold ideas into reality.
   

  

 We firmly believe that the foundation of any successful company lies in its culture. At Ingrid Capacity, we understand that building a thriving organization demands more than just technology and innovation; it requires a company culture firmly rooted in trust, growth, and the ability to learn from mistakes. We believe that skills can be nurtured in a variety of contexts, starting from within oneself and growing together with people we trust. We are also serious about the wellbeing of our colleagues and having fun together, and with regularly hosted social activities and group training classes, we create a workplace where we can truly thrive.
   

  

**Application**
 Sounds like a match? Don’t be a stranger and welcome to apply! We’ll make selections on an ongoing basis and finalize the recruitment as soon as we’ve found the perfect match.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 /Team Ingrid Capacity

title: Experienced advisor | Global Compliance Services
description:
Are you ready to take the next step in your career? Do you have a solid understanding of, and a passion for, creating value through accounting and financial reporting? Would you love to work in a community of solvers together with some of Sweden's top advisors and specialists? Come and join us at PwC!
   

  

**Become a part of PwC's Financial Reporting's Global Compliance Service**
 We are looking for an experienced advisor to join our team of Financial Reporting’s Global Compliance Services (GCS) practice. The position is a role as an engagement manager within our group that specialises in supporting global clients with their Swedish subsidiaries’ statutory accounting obligations (including their annual reports). Acting as an engagement manager means being responsible for supporting the engagement members and reviewing their work.
   

  

 The GCS practice blends our combination of practical and technical subject matter expertise in preparing statutory Swedish financial statements for our clients. We also help with Group to Swedish GAAP reconciliations as well as proactively supporting throughout our clients’ audit processes. Our multinational clients range from global leaders to mid-tier and smaller groups across a wide range of industry sectors.
   

  

***In your role as engagement manager, your primary responsibilities will include:***
  

  

* Up-front scoping and engagement planning
* Ensure engagement compliance with PwC risk management policies
* Reviewing Swedish statutory reports (including data collection) and GAAP analyses in order to ensure compliance with local laws/regulations
* Having frequent interaction and coordinate with clients and the PwC network
* Identifying opportunities to further support our clients with related PwC services and helping clients to manage their accounting risks
* Organising, monitoring and managing projects to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery
* Work with leadership on:
+ Overall project statuses
+ Budget compliance/management
+ Participating in proposals for potential new clients


 ,
   

  

***Your profile***
 We’re looking for someone who has hands-on experience from accounting and Swedish financial reporting (both K3 and K2), as well as understanding of finance reporting processes. You are able to plan, execute and prioritise projects where the scope of the project and time plan may change several times. You have high social skills and appreciate a role where international relationship building and trust are central.
   

  

***To succeed in this role, we expect you to have:***
* Bachelor’s degree in Economics
* Proficiency in spoken and written English and Swedish
* Approx. 4-5 year previous experience from hands-on working with Swedish GAAP
* Experience of preparing and/or reviewing financial reports in accordance with Swedish GAAP
* Demonstrated ability to drive and coordinate projects
* Great skills of Microsoft Excel


**It’s An Advantage If You Have** 
  

  

* Previous experience from working on a larger international accounting firm
* Previous experience from working in an international network setting (e.g. to work across borders and cultures)
* Previous experience from working with IFRS and/or US GAAP
* Great skills in:
+ G Suite and/or MS Office
+ Capego


**It Is a Significant Advantage If You Have**
* Previous experience from working with financial reporting outsourcing projects for international clients
* Previous experience working within the Financial Reporting module of Workiva


**What We Offer You**
 A career in Financial Reporting’s GCS practice will provide you with the opportunity to, together with some of Sweden's top advisors and specialists, deliver value to clients by supporting their accounting function and helping them solve practical problems. PwC's unique offering to our clients is that we function as a one-stop shop, bringing e.g. accounting, financial reporting, compliance, valuation and tax expertise to the table in one go.
   

  

**Does it all sound good to you? We’re looking forward to your application!**
**Please Submit a Complete Application Including**
* CV
* Cover letter where you describe what motivates you in this field


 Your application can be written in either Swedish or English. Since we are continuously reviewing the applications please apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 Read more about who we are, and how we are safeguarding inclusion and diversity through our recruiting at www.pwc.se/karriar.
   

  

 Do you have any questions regarding the recruitment process please contact the responsible recruiter down below.
   

  

**Recruitment process** 
*We believe in the strength of having a recruitment process that applies to everyone. As part of the selection, we use psychometric tests to ensure an objective, unbiased, and fair selection.*
*We value the personal meeting to understand the value you can bring to PwC and what we can offer you. The interview process usually consists of multiple stages and various types of interviews. During the interview with the business, you will have the opportunity to meet with the relevant team to discuss the role. When meeting with HR, you will have a competency-based interview where we examine the personality test you completed before the interview.*

title: Marketing Manager - Nordics
description:
**Who we are:**
 For over 20 years, Global Relay has set the standard in enterprise information archiving with industry-leading cloud archiving, surveillance, eDiscovery, and analytics solutions. We securely capture and preserve the communications data of the world’s most highly regulated firms, giving them greater visibility and control over their information and ensuring compliance with stringent regulations.
   

  

 Though we offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other perks one would expect from an established company, we are not your typical technology company. Global Relay is a career-building company. A place for big ideas. New challenges. Groundbreaking innovation. It’s a place where you can genuinely make an impact – and be recognized for it.
   

  

 We believe great businesses thrive on diversity, inclusion, and the contributions of all employees. To that end, we recruit candidates from different backgrounds and foster a work environment that encourages employees to collaborate and learn from each other, completely free of barriers.
   

  

 We encourage you to apply if your qualifications and experience are a good fit for any of our openings.
   

  

**Your role:**
 The Marketing Manager - Nordics will play a critical role in developing and executing Global Relay’s marketing strategy in Sweden and across the Nordic region. The successful candidate will be responsible for building brand awareness, creating engaging content, and driving market entry initiatives.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will be a native Swedish speaker, fluent in English, with a strong background in marketing, particularly in B2B, technology, and/or the financial services sector. We are looking for someone with a can-do attitude and a willing to roll up their sleeves: the Stockholm office is a new venture for Global Relay, and you will be instrumental in helping build its success.
   

  

**Your responsibilities:**
* Working closely with the global Marketing team, develop and execute a go-to-market strategy to establish Global Relay’s brand and product offering in the Nordics
* Plan and implement marketing campaigns to drive brand awareness, lead generation, and customer engagement
* Conduct market research to identify target market, sentiment, competitors, and opportunities in the region
* Assist in the ideation and management of internal events based out of our newly-opened Stockholm office
* Create compelling and localized marketing content, including blogs, case studies, and campaigns (in both Swedish and English)
* Understand Global Relay’s strategic and brand objectives and create a marketing plan to meet them
* Ensure all content aligns with Global Relay’s brand and resonates with the target audience
* Work collaboratively with the Nordics-based sales team to assist in the creation of execution of sales initiatives, where necessary
* Assist in the ideation and management of internal events based out of our newly opened Stockholm office


**About you:** 
  

  

  

* Demonstrable experience of building or to contributing to successful marketing campaigns
* An understanding of marketing strategy and the various mediums that inform such a strategy (digital marketing, content marketing, product marketing, etc)
* A good knowledge of Swedish/Nordic B2B practices, ideally in FinServ or new technologies as well as experience in developing brands to meet Nordic sentiment
* The ability to work collaboratively with a global team (on Zoom, IM, etc.) to see a project through from inception to fruition
* Excellent people skills and the experience to manage the expectations of key stakeholders of varying levels of seniority
* A willing to roll up their sleeves and get stuck in to with projects, particularly the running and management of events while the team grows
* A clear aptitude for organization and project management skills to assist with the running of marketing initiatives – from campaigns to events
* Experience in writing or creating content in various mediums, from emails to blogs
* Other useful experience includes:
+ Experience in using CMS systems (WordPress)
+ Demandbase
+ Content reporting tools (Google Analytics, Looker Studio)


**What you can expect:**
 At Global Relay, there’s no ceiling to what you can achieve. It’s the land of opportunity for the energetic, the intelligent, the driven. You’ll receive the mentoring, coaching, and support you need to reach your career goals. You’ll be part of a culture that breeds creativity and rewards perseverance and hard work. And you’ll be working alongside smart, talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with complementary knowledge and skills.
   

  

 Global Relay is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.
   

  

 We seek to ensure reasonable adjustments, accommodations, and personal time are tailored to meet the unique needs of every individual.
   

  

 We understand flexible work arrangements are important, and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it’s flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.
   

  

 To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

title: Revenue Operations Manager
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 We are looking for a highly skilled and technically adept
 **Revenue** 
**Operations** 
**Manager** 
 with a deep understanding of
 **revenue attribution models** 
 . In this role, you will focus on designing, optimizing, and automating customer journeys while ensuring accurate measurement of marketing efforts across various touchpoints. You'll be part of our Revenue Operations team working closely with Marketing, Revenue Analytics, and Data teams to bridge the gap between technology, marketing strategy, and performance measurement to deliver scalable systems that drive predictable revenue growth.
   

  

 This role reports to our Director of MarTech & Operations.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Revenue Attribution Management: Drive the development, implementation, and optimization of revenue attribution model tailored to Mentimeter. Ensure that all customer touchpoints, from awareness through to conversion, are accurately tracked and measured.
* Customer Journey Optimization: Design and orchestrate end-to-end customer journeys that align with buying cycles and ensure attribution across multiple channels and stages. Use attribution data to optimize and refine these journeys for improved performance and ROI.
* Tech Stack Management & Integration: Optimize the marketing technology stack, including CRM, marketing automation platforms, and analytics tools. Ensure seamless integration between platforms, focusing on accurate data flow for attribution modeling and reporting.
* Data-Driven Decision Making: Work with Data and Revenue Analytics teams to ensure accurate data tracking and reporting across touchpoints. Develop and manage dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights on marketing performance, customer engagement, and attribution.
* Process Automation & Scalability: Implement automated systems and workflows that scale across the marketing department. Focus on automation opportunities that reduce manual work, streamline reporting, and improve the consistency of attribution data.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with marketing, sales, revenue analytics, and data teams to ensure alignment on revenue attribution strategy and technology implementation. Act as the technical expert in attribution modeling and provide guidance on best practices across teams.
* Tool Evaluation and Optimization: Continuously assess new technologies, tools, and platforms that can improve the revenue attribution process. Recommend and implement tools that provide deeper insights into B2B customer journeys and enhance tracking capabilities.


**What Success Looks Like**
* Attribution Model Successfully building revenue attribution models, ensuring accurate tracking of all customer touchpoints and providing clear insights into how different channels contribute to revenue.
* Scalable Systems: Building and optimizing scalable systems that improve marketing efficiency and ensure accurate reporting across teams.
* Data-Driven Marketing: Driving better decision-making across teams through data-backed insights and reports, particularly around B2B customer journeys and attribution.
* Collaboration & Integration: Leading cross-functional initiatives to ensure seamless integration between marketing technology, revenue operations, and data teams, driving alignment and optimized outcomes.


**Required Skills & Experience**
* Revenue Attribution Expertise: 5+ years of experience working with revenue attribution models in SaaS, ideally in Product-led growth companies. Proven ability to manage attribution models for complex sales cycles with multiple touchpoints across the buyer journey.
* Expertise in Tech Stack: Hands-on experience with MarTech platforms, including CRM systems, marketing automation tools, customer engagement tools, ABM tools and analytics platforms such as Braze, Salesforce, 6Sense, Looker, High touch etc.
* Data Integration & Analysis: Strong experience in integrating and managing data across multiple systems (CRM, analytics, and marketing automation platforms) and analyzing performance data to derive actionable insights.
* Reporting & Dashboarding: Experience building dashboards and reports that track the effectiveness of multi-channel marketing efforts, optimize attribution models, and provide key performance insights.
* Automation Expertise: Proven track record of implementing and optimizing marketing automation systems, driving efficiency, and enhancing performance through technology.
* Project Management: Ability to lead and manage technical projects related to revenue attribution, from tool selection to implementation and ongoing optimization.


**Impact & Scope**
* Revenue Impact: Direct influence on marketing and sales efforts by providing clear, actionable insights into customer journeys and touchpoint effectiveness, driving revenue growth.
* Craft expertise: Ownership of key attribution models and systems, influencing B2B go-to-market strategies across marketing, sales, and revenue operations.
* Cross-Department Influence: Drive collaboration between marketing, revenue operations, and data teams to improve data quality, attribution accuracy, and marketing performance.


**Apply today with your CV in English to join our Revenue Operations team at Mentimeter!**
 At Mentimeter where we currently boast over 50+ different nationalities, you'll be part of a culture that values creativity, innovation, and inclusivity. We believe in supporting our team members' growth and offering them the platform to excel. If you're eager to contribute to our mission and make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

 Not sure you meet 100% of our requirements?
   

  

 Apply anyway and let us know why you would enjoy working on this particular role at Mentimeter!
   

  

 Please note that this role will have its base in our
 **Stockholm** 
**office** 
 and is primarily an
 **onsite** 
 position with the possibility to work from home up to twice per week.
   

  

 Learn more here about Our Ways of Working - Guiding Principles.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Cybersecurity Analyst (SOC)
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for more Cybersecurity Analysts to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Managed Security Services domain.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 300 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. We are now looking for more Cybersecurity Analysts who wants to work in our Security Operations Center and be at the forefront to stop cyber breaches.
   

  

**Managed Security Services**
 Truesec helps customers globally with Attack Prediction Services, Vulnerability Management Services and Managed Detection & Response services for IT and OT environments. Our services are all delivered by skilled security analysis teams that conducts 24/7 attack monitoring, threat hunting, threat intelligence analysis, and threat remediation. Our team of experts works tirelessly to identify and prevent cyber breaches, and to help increase our customers’ proactive cybersecurity defenses. Our goal is to be an extension of our customers’ IT organizations, customizing a combination of capabilities and tooling, tailored to prevent cyber attacks in the most efficient way.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Cybersecurity Analyst, you act as a first responder that analyzes alerts, eliminates false positives, and in the event of an IOA (indicator of attack), immediately notifies your team and/or takes action to mitigate the attack, contain the threat, and protect the data. This means that you’re responsible to keep the clients’ IT environments safe, and to prevent breach.
   

  

 You will always have a team that supports you if needed, we have continuous knowledge sharing and weekly meetings with an educational purpose to share new findings and insights. You will have 5 weeks /year dedicated for individual development, were we promote you to find relevant trainings, aim for that next certification our join other cyber specialists in their expertise of area. To let curiosity lead has proven to be a successful way to develop new experts in various areas within Truesec.
   

  

 The team works in shifts on a rolling schedule, to ensure clients’ operations are secured 24/7.
   

  

 The shifts has been worked out and set together with the team to secure well-sized periods for recovery.
   

  

**Your Potential Background**
 We believe that you are at the beginning of your IT career or are newly graduated from university, college, or equivalent education for the role. Alternatively, you have previous experience working in a monitoring center for IT, such as a NOC or SOC.
   

  

 But most important, is your drive and interest to make a difference, to continuously
   

  

 learn and evolve, and your determination to stay up to date on the latest information in cybersecurity.
   

  

 We highly value your interest in cybersecurity and your goal of working and developing in this industry. To fit this role, we believe that you:
   

  

* Have basic knowledge in IT security and network essentials.
* Are methodical and structured and possess a strong analytical ability.
* Have basic programming and scripting knowledge (e.g., PowerShell or Bash).


 If you have experience using software for log management and monitoring, for example, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Carbon Black, CrowdStrike, SIEM-tools,
   

  

 Vectra, Darktrace, or similar tools, that’s good, but it’s not a requirement.
   

  

 Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.
   

  

**What We Offer**
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Nätverkstekniker till SEK
description:
*Är du en erfaren nätverkstekniker som vill ha en central roll i att utveckla och förvalta en modern nätverksinfrastruktur? Hos Svensk Exportkredit får du möjlighet att designa, implementera och optimera nätverkslösningar som säkerställer en stabil och säker IT-miljö.*
**Din Vardag**
 Som nätverkstekniker hos Svensk Exportkredit har du ett helhetsansvar för nätverksdesign, drift och utveckling. Du arbetar både operativt och strategiskt för att säkerställa en säker, effektiv och framtidssäkrad nätverksmiljö. I rollen ingår även att identifiera förbättringsområden och driva förändringsinitiativ för att möta verksamhetens behov.
   

  

 Du deltar som sakkunnig i större projekt och förändringar av IT-infrastrukturen, samtidigt som du samarbetar nära IT-avdelningen, verksamhetens beställare och externa leverantörer.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**
* Design, drift och underhåll av nätverksinfrastruktur.
* Felsökning, optimering och utveckling av nätverkslösningar.
* Delta i strategiska IT-projekt och förändringsarbeten inom nätverk och säkerhet.
* Analysera processer och rutiner för att driva förbättringar och effektiviseringar.
* Säkerställa att nätverkslösningarna uppfyller verksamhetens och säkerhetskraven.


 Passar vi dig?
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har:
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av en liknande roll
* Djup kunskap om Cisco-produkter
* Erfarenhet av Palo Alto-brandväggar
* Erfarenhet av KEMP Lastbalanserare
* Erfarenhet av SolarWinds-övervakning


 Som person är du en lagspelare som tar dig tid och uppskattar att hjälpa andra. Du tar stort ansvar i din roll och har en god förmåga att arbeta proaktivt. Du ser förbättringspotential med lätthet och är inte rädd för att komma med egna initiativ för att driva förändring.
   

  

**Hur du ansöker**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Svensk Exportkredit med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer om jobbet, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult, Gustaf Linder, gustaf.linder@wiseit.se .
   

  

 Wise IT kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail, då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Urval sker löpande. Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**TILLSAMMANS FÖR ÖKAD SVENSK EXPORT**
 Jobba för en hållbar värld genom ökad svensk export! Med affärsmannaskap , starkt kundfokus och en vilja att nå resultat, blir du en viktig lagspelare i Team SEK. Det finns en närhet och enkelhet här som underlättar samarbete och gör beslutsvägar korta. Vi tar vara på engagemang och gör det möjligt för alla att ta ansvar och vara med och påverka. I vårt ekosystem av förstklassig kompetens kan du verkligen växa. Var med och forma vår historia, som går över gränser och generationer.
   

  

**OM SEK**
 SEK är ett statligt bolag som finansierar svenska exportföretag, deras underleverantörer och utländska kunder. Vi finansierar även omställning i Sverige och utomlands. I vårt uppdrag ingår att administrera det statsstödda CIRR-systemet. I 60 år har lån från SEK gjort det möjligt för generationer av svenska företag att växa. Med ökad export skapar vi tillväxt i Sverige och bidrar till nytänkande lösningar för en hållbar utveckling i världen

title: Fullstackutvecklare C#/React
description:
****Vill du arbeta i ett fantastiskt team som jobbar nära verksamheten för att bygga plattformen som möjliggör att våra kunder får den bästa digitala upplevelsen när de ska boka och åka på resor!****
**Om tjänsten**
 Vi söker en fullstackutvecklare till vårt Fundamentals team. Teamet ansvar för plattformen som ligger till grund för våra kundkanaler (webbar och appar). Vi har ambitionen att ligga i framkant och jobba med modern teknik.
   

  

 Teamen ansvarar för hela kedjan från kravförståelse, utveckling, deploy till förvaltning och support. Vi jobbar agilt med continuous delivery. Det viktigaste för oss är inte bara vilka tekniker du kan idag utan din inställning, nyfikenhet och viljan att lära nytt och bidra till vår vidareutveckling och kultur. I teamet arbetar vi idag med en del par-/mobbprogrammering och nära verksamheten med snabba feedbackloppar för ständig förbättring.
   

  

 Vi är 13 utvecklingsteam på vår IT-avdelning och vi utvecklar våra system i Microsoft miljö med moderna tekniker, ramverk och verktyg såsom .NET Core, C#, Node, Azure, React, JavaScript, Typescript, MS-SQL, Redis, Visual Studio, etc. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper då vi ser att en bra teamdynamik är en förutsättning för våra leveranser.
   

  

****Vem vi söker****
 Till Ving söker vi nu en engagerad och leveransfokuserad fullstackutvecklare.
   

  

**Vi önskar att du uppfyller följande punkter:**
* 7+ års erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom C#.Net, Node.
* Erfarenhet av React
* Relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning.
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift.


**Det är meriterande om du även har erfarenhet av:**
* CMS (Umbraco)
* Headless
* Molnbaserade tjänster (gärna Azure)

 Vi söker dig som är en teamspelare som värdesätter samarbete och aktivt bidrar till teamets framgång. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper då vi ser att en bra teamdynamik är en förutsättning för våra leveranser.

 Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö där du får möjlighet till en intern karriär. Du får en omväxlande vardag tillsammans med härliga kollegor - vi arbetar i nära samarbete mellan de nordiska länderna för att ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året. Vi har bra reseförmåner och dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!
   

  

****Övrigt****
 Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst och placerad på Vings fina huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Det är möjligt med distansarbete upp till 2 dagar per vecka när det passar med teamet/arbetet. Arbetsspråk är svenska. Intervjuer kommer ske löpande så skicka din ansökan idag!
   

  

 Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Susanne Almqvist på susanne.almqvist@nltg.com eller på telefon 070-951 34 32.
   

  

**I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs – ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Testerna utgår från vedertagen forskning och ger oss möjlighet att på ett opartiskt sätt bedöma dina styrkor och eventuella utmaningar i relation till aktuell tjänst. Under rekryteringsprocessen kommer du att få testerna skickade till dig med mer information, är du nyfiken redan nu kan du läsa mer om dem hos** 
**Alva Labs** 
**.**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Backend Engineer - Personalization
description:
On the Personalization Team, we seek to understand the audio world better than anyone else so that we can make great recommendations to every individual person and keep the world listening. Every day, hundreds of millions of people all over the world use the products we build, from Podcast Feeds to Discovery Weekly to DJ. We're a team of technologists, product insight experts, designers, and product managers in Boston, New York, Stockholm, and London.
   

  

 Spotify is looking for a Backend Engineer to join the Search team. Our mission is to help users efficiently find and discover content. We are a highly collaborative team of engineers from multiple disciplines who are passionate about new challenges, product innovation, and building highly scalable distributed systems. We have experience in using new technologies to quickly prototype experiences as well as in building systems that serve content at scale for hundreds of millions of users.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Design, develop, and deliver robust and scalable backend systems and APIs.
* Collaborate with other engineers, product owners, and designers to identify and solve challenging problems and build new product features.
* Write clean, maintainable, well-documented code, adhering to coding best practices.
* Participate in the improvement of our software development standards and practices.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging backend technologies and best practices.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have experience writing distributed, high-volume Java services and know how to deploy and keep them running in production.
* You feel comfortable reading and writing Python code.
* You have a good understanding of data structures and algorithms and understand how to apply them to design pragmatic solutions.
* You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and can communicate your ideas to technical and non-technical audiences.
* You love working in an environment where you constantly experiment and iterate quickly.
* You believe data is the most powerful tool for informed decision-making.
* You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code.
* You have practical experience with Kubernetes.
* You have practical experience managing and operating scalable search engines like ElasticSearch or Vespa.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the EMEA region as long as we have a work location. \*excluding France for now due to on-call restrictions.
* This team operates within the Central Eastern time zone for collaboration.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Validation Engineer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 Are you an experienced Post-Silicon Validation Engineer ready to make an impact? Join our global, dedicated validation team within the Silicon Productization Engineering division, where we validate and verify state-of-the-art ASICs shaping the future of networking and telecommunications.
   

  

 Our global team is distributed across Kista (SE), Lund (SE), and Austin (US). You will be based in Kista, with occasional travel to other locations as needed. As a Validation Engineer, your responsibilities will span the entire silicon lifecycle—from early feasibility studies to post-silicon validation and long-term product support.
   

  

 In this role, you will develop validation frameworks, write test specifications, create test plans, and execute electrical measurements, functional validation, and end-to-end system testing.
   

  

 We’re looking for a collaborative, solution-oriented team player who is also self-driven, approach challenges with creativity, and has an openness to new ideas and continuous improvement. If you're passionate about advancing validation methods and eager to explore emerging technologies, this opportunity is for you.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Validate high-quality, high-performance ASIC products to meet technical specifications and customer expectations.
* Customize test scripts and programs, define test board requirements, and create robust validation plans.
* Contribute to silicon bring-up, including debugging and root cause analysis.
* Perform electrical characterization, compliance testing, power correlation, and performance analysis.
* Troubleshoot technical issues and provide expert support throughout product development cycles.
* Drive continuous improvement in validation processes, methodologies, and product quality.
* Collaborate and coordinate with global ASIC validation teams.


**The skills you bring:**
* 5+ years of experience in block-level and system-level functional testing and validation.
* Solid understanding of ASICs, FPGAs, and hardware validation environments, with proven capability in designing and troubleshooting complex setups.
* Background in microcontrollers, embedded systems, and ability to interpret schematics and experience using layout tools.
* Strong hands-on experience with lab equipment such as BERTs, oscilloscopes, and other instrumentation.
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python and MATLAB, along with strong programming skills in C/C++. Experience with version control tools (Git is a bonus)
* Technical experience in interfaces and technologies like SERDES, Ethernet, PCIe, CPRI, DDR, Power, Clock, and I3C.
* Strong analytical skills, capable of interpreting validation data, diagnosing issues, and deriving actionable insights to enhance product quality and performance.
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal, with the ability to document findings and collaborate effectively across teams.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
